recommendations.title: How to (Finally) Break That Bad Habit
recommendations.excerpt: Neuroscientists and psychologists explain how to keep yourself on track—for good this time.

recommendations.title: The Great American Cool
recommendations.excerpt: In the past, taste was scouted from hip kids and sold to the masses. But in the great river of content, what does cool even mean?

recommendations.title: I Danced Every Day for a Year
recommendations.excerpt: A writer chronicles what she learned about her mind and body choreographing routines 365 days in a row.

recommendations.title: What causes motion sickness—and how can you prevent it?
recommendations.excerpt: Traveling by boat, car, or even through virtual reality can make some people queasy. Experts weigh in on what to do about it.

recommendations.title: How India’s rulers have dashed the hopes of its younger citizens
recommendations.excerpt: Increasing unemployment is a major cause for concern.

recommendations.title: The Curious Case of Nebraska Man
recommendations.excerpt: A fossil tooth, a splashy debate, and a strange chapter in America’s long history of science denialism.

recommendations.title: UK inflation: Study abroad journey for Indians gets tougher amid struggle for affordable living
recommendations.excerpt: Indians may have been issued the largest number of UK students visa this year but finding accommodation and surviving in cities where their colleges or universities are based has become a challenge for international students with the increase in inflation.

recommendations.title: Why Do You Get Sick in the Winter? Blame Your Nose
recommendations.excerpt: A new study shows that as temperatures drop, nasal cells release fewer of the tiny protectors that bind and neutralize invading germs.

recommendations.title: The Day Queen Elizabeth Died: The Inside Story of Her Final Hours
recommendations.excerpt: Plans in the event of Queen Elizabeth II’s death were meticulous; they were revisited and updated regularly. On 8 September, they were executed flawlessly. But not everything could be anticipated.

recommendations.title: Kendrick Lamar’s New Chapter: Raw, Intimate and Unconstrained
recommendations.excerpt: In partnership with his longtime collaborator, Dave Free, the greatest rapper of his generation is pushing himself — commercially and creatively — onto unexpected terrain.

recommendations.title: The Best Exercises To Regain Balance After 60, Trainer Says
recommendations.excerpt: As you grow older, your physical fitness begins to deteriorate if you don't take action to preserve it. Research actually shows that your balance starts declining once you reach midlife, around 50 years of age.

recommendations.title: The simple diet swap to help you lose weight and lower health risks
recommendations.excerpt: Replace processed carbs with “healthy” carbs like fruits, vegetables and whole grains for better metabolic health.

recommendations.title: How We Learned to Be Lonely
recommendations.excerpt: In the early days of the pandemic, many of us got used to solitude. It’s a habit we need to break.

recommendations.title: In This Seaside Town, the New Year Brings a Battle With the ‘Witches of the Sea’
recommendations.excerpt: The local Epiphany celebration of Grado, Italy, is inspired by a mysterious band of 16th-century pirates.

recommendations.title: The 35 must-see TV shows to look forward to in 2023
recommendations.excerpt: A hardy period drama from Shane Meadows, a Frasier reboot and the fourth series of Succession – here’s a rundown of all the new year’s unmissable telly

recommendations.title: The historical origins of the de-cluttered home
recommendations.excerpt: Religion, art and politics have all led to the minimalist idea of "less is more". Dominic Lutyens explores the ideas and aesthetics behind pared-back simplicity.

recommendations.title: What causes burnout, and how to prevent it
recommendations.excerpt: The concept of burnout is nothing new. But there are ways to prevent burnout and promote greater engagement with work.

recommendations.title: The Crying Game
recommendations.excerpt: I bawled my eyes out every day for nearly three years. So I hatched a radical plan to take back my tear ducts.

recommendations.title: The Michigan lawyer pushing Trump’s voter-fraud fictions in U.S. court
recommendations.excerpt: Stefanie Lambert was a Detroit defense lawyer working on a succession of routine criminal cases – theft, drug possession and firearms charges. Then Donald Trump’s 2020 election loss transformed her life.

recommendations.title: What It’s Like to Retire in Your Early 20s
recommendations.excerpt: Some former college athletes face the existential crisis of a career ending at a young age.

recommendations.title: The Many Metaphors of Metamorphosis
recommendations.excerpt: Not every transition must be a caterpillar into a butterfly, or a solitary trek through terror and pain. The natural world has other models of transformation.

recommendations.title: The Vibes Are Off at Tesla
recommendations.excerpt: Layoffs, lawsuits, delays, Twitter chaos, stock in free fall, factory shutdowns — What happened to America’s favorite electric car company?

recommendations.title: How to Get Rid of Milia Safely, According to Dermatologists
recommendations.excerpt: You look in the mirror and there they are: a bunch of tiny, hard white spots on your face, possibly with a faint blue tint.

recommendations.title: In Age of Vice, India’s answer to The Godfather, Deepti Kapoor takes no prisoners
recommendations.excerpt: Wealth meets deceit in this searing crime thriller set in New Delhi that’s being touted as India’s answer to The Godfather.

recommendations.title: Relationship Blind Spots: How To Tell if Yours Has One and What To Do About It
recommendations.excerpt: 2023 may be the year for gaining clarity on your relationship, what you want and what needs work.

recommendations.title: Riddle solved: Why was Roman concrete so durable?
recommendations.excerpt: An unexpected ancient manufacturing strategy may hold the key to designing concrete that lasts for millennia.

recommendations.title: Five ways to avoid pain and injury when starting a new exercise regime
recommendations.excerpt: Getting in the habit of exercising isn’t easy. Not only is finding the time to exercise a major deterrent for people, the fear of aches, pain and injuries is also a reason that people put off starting a new exercise regime. But exercise doesn’t necessarily have to lead to pain or injuries.

recommendations.title: What Can We See in the Oldest-Known Photographs of Kandahar?
recommendations.excerpt: These 72 images are a rare glimpse of an ancient city lost to time and conflict.

recommendations.title: Scientists Grew Stem Cell 'Mini Brains' And Then The Brains Sort-of Developed Eyes
recommendations.excerpt: Mini brains grown in a lab from stem cells spontaneously developed rudimentary eye structures, scientists reported in a fascinating 2021 paper.

recommendations.title: Why not all comfort food is the same
recommendations.excerpt: Every food culture has certain dishes that people turn to in times of need. And no one food is a comfort food staple right across the world. Here's why.
